item.title: Cars parked on the bike lane, 7th August
item.description:
There are cars parked in a hazardous location on Union street. As shown in the picture this is going to cause an accident at some point. Its unsafe and an immediate threat to public safety. The issue starts around the bar of Lord Nelson up untill the A201. I would say the danger is mostly there at night, certainly with the black cars in front as yesterday was the case 06.08.2025

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 235-241, Union Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident keeps dumping rubbish in the front of the house and Surrounding area., 7th August
item.description:
Resident on 2 Sennene Walk keeps dumping rubbish outside of her property, it has been happening since she moved in. Last night we saw mices coming out of her property and also from the rubbish she leaves in the from of the house. Lots of residents complained about this situation and no action was taken. Nother thing to mention is, se keeps her weelie bin outside where all other residents keepts it inside of their residencies.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blanchard Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping issue at this corner, 7th August
item.description:
This corner is CONSTANTLY being used for fly tipping. There is a bag now ripped open by foxes and its contents are all over the place. Unfortunately this occurs constantly and I think we need to think of ways to combat more proactively and at the source… either with CCTV or installing a large bin on Victory Place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elba Place, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged Kerb — Again, 7th August
item.description:
